topicName: Gastrointestinal tract (lower) cancers - recognition and referral
topicSummary: Colorectal cancer - around 40,000 new colorectal cancers are diagnosed each year in the UK, up to a quarter of these following screening.

topicHtmlObjects.htmlHeader: Gastrointestinal tract (lower) cancers - recognition and referral: Summary

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: To reflect NICE amendment to recommendation 1.3.4 (superseded by newly-published NICE diagnostics guidance on quantitative faecal immunochemical tests to guide referral for colorectal cancer in primary care).

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: The National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) quality standards for suspected cancer have been added to this topic.

latestChanges.title: Revised
latestChanges.body: This topic is a direct implementation of the National Institute for Health and Care Excellence guideline Suspected cancer: recognition and referral NICE, 2015. This CKS topic replaces the former topic on GI (lower) cancer - suspected.
